CDCRef Class Reference

#include <handleref.h>

Detailed Description

HDC needs special handling, since there are two valid cleanups - DeleteDC - ReleaseDC.

Definition at line 198 of file handleref.h.

Public Member Functions

 CDCRef ()
 creates a null handle

 operator HDC () const
 retrieve a device context handle

 CDCRef (HDC dc, bool deleteOnRelease)
 initializes the handler For the second parameter, you can specify: - CDCRef::Null for a null deleter (handle is not destroyed) - CDCRef::Delete to call DeleteDC (when the handle was acquired by CreateDC) - CDCRef::Release to call ReleaseDC (when the handle was acquired by GetDC)

 CDCRef (HWND wnd, HDC dc, bool releaseOnRelease)

Static Public Member Functions

CDCRef GetDC (HWND wnd)
 implements GetDC, returning a valid CDCRef for more information, see MSDN: GetDC

CDCRef GetDCEx (HWND wnd, HRGN rgnClip, DWORD flags)
 implements GetDC, returning a valid CDCRef for more information, see MSDN: GetDCEx

CDCRef GetWindowDC (HWND wnd)
CDCRef CreateDC (LPCTSTR lpszDriver, LPCTSTR lpszDevice, LPCTSTR lpszOutput, CONST DEVMODE *lpInitData, bool infoDCOnly=false)
 implements CreateDC / CreateIC, returning a valid CDCRef for more information, see MSDN: CreateDC specify idonDCOnly=true to call CreateIC instead of CreateDC.

CDCRef CreateCompatibleDC (HDC dc)
 implements CreateCompatibleDC, returning a valid CDCRef for more information, see MSDN: CreateCompatibleDC
